resourcespetialitation module¶

resourcespetialitation.gaussian(x, mu, var)[source]¶

Returns the value of evaluating a gaussian exp((x-mu)^{2}/2var^{2})

Return type:float
resourcespetialitation.gaussianSpecialization(NoResources, variance)[source]¶

Returns a np array representing a discreate distribution of the spacialization variation of a species. Of gaussian shape.

Parameters:
  • NoResources (int) – Width of the distribution
  • variance (float) – Variance of the gaussian distribution
Return type:

np array
resourcespetialitation.generatePopulation(species, NoIndividuals)[source]¶

Returns a list of individuals of a given species

Parameters:
  • species (species) – the species of the generated individuals
  • NoIndividuals (int) – Number of individuals to be generated
Returns:

A list of individuals
Return type:

list[individual]
class resourcespetialitation.individual(species)[source]¶

Represents a single individual

Parameters:

species (species) – the specie of the indiviudal to be instanced
Variables:
  • resource (int) – the resource specialitation of this individual
  • species – Its species id

:vartype species : int :var place_in_list: place (index) in the list resourceSpace.individuals :vartype place_in_list: int :var place_in_resource: index in list resourceSpace.space[resource][index] where the individual is located :vartype place_in_resource: int

class resourcespetialitation.resourceSpace(NoResources)[source]¶

Represent the resource space where individuals are

Parameters:

NoResources (int) – Size of the space
Variables:
  • NoResources (int) – size of the resources space
  • space (list[list[individual]]) – list of list. The position in the list represent the resource, the list there is a list of individuals with that specialization.
  • capacity (array[int]) – array indicating the maximun number of individuals allowed per resource
  • individuals (list[species]) – Unordered list of individuals in the resource space
InsertIndividual(Individual)[source]¶

Inserts an Individual in the resources space

Parameters:Individual (individual) – Individual to be inserted
InsertPopulation(Population)[source]¶

Inserts a Population in the resources space

Parameters:Population (list[individual]) – The population to be inserted
KillIndividual(Individual)[source]¶

Eliminate the Individual from resource space. The Individual should previously habe been inserted with InsertIndividual(Individual) for this to work. A list of the inserted Individuals is in self.individuals

Parameters:Individual (individual) – The individual to be eliminate
bindResoucesCapacity(ResourcesCapacity)[source]¶

Bind the array characterizing the capacity of each resource to the instance of resourceSpace

Parameters:ResourcesCapacity – The array of capacities of the resources. Should be the same size or larger

than the size of the resource space size :type ResourcesCapacity: list(int) or numpy.array(int)

class resourcespetialitation.species(birthR, deadR, mainResource, ResourceSpecialization, id)[source]¶

Represents a species

param deadR:Dead rate of species’s individuals

 the central resouce of the specie
param ResourceSpecialization:
 Distribution of resource variation around the mainResource
param id:id of the specie
type birthR:float
type deadR:float

 int
type ResourceSpecialization:
 array[float]
type id:int
return:objet describing a species

bindSpecialitation(mainResource, ResourceSpecialization)[source]¶

Relocates the resource spetialitation distribution to a absolute position where the mainResource is in the center of the distribution given by Resourcespecialization

Parameters:
  • mainResource (int) – location of the Resouce distribution
  • ResourceSpecialization (array[float]) – distribution of specialization
Returns:

array of float representing the resource specialitation in absolute position
Return type:

array[float]

Parameters:ResourceSpecialization (array[float]) – Discreate distribution representing the variability of resources specialitation
Returns:Discreate cumulative probability
